issue.title: [CF 709] Lua error in config
issue.body:
IMPORTANT: If your issue is only occurring with a specific icon, include an export string of the icon in this ticket. Subsequently, if the issue involves an entire group or an entire profile, include the entire export string of the group or profile.

To get an export string, open the icon editor, and click button labeled "Import/Export/Backup". Select the "To string" option for the appropriate export type (icon, group, or profile), and then press CTRL+C to copy it to your clipboard.

FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THE ABOVE INSTRUCTIONS WILL RESULT IN YOUR TICKET BEING INVALIDATED.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Open configuration
2. Try to make condition based on talent specialization

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
I get a lua error and the condition editor completely bugs

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
6.0.4

Do you have an error log of what happened?

Message: ...Ons\TellMeWhen\Components\Core\Conditions\Config.lua:219: attempt to compare function with number
Time: 11/24/12 19:38:29
Count: 4
Stack: (tail call): ?
...Ons\TellMeWhen\Components\Core\Conditions\Config.lua:219: in function `ValidateLevelForCondition'
...Ons\TellMeWhen\Components\Core\Conditions\Config.lua:907: in function `SetSliderMinMax'
...Ons\TellMeWhen\Components\Core\Conditions\Config.lua:833: in function <...Ons\TellMeWhen\Components\Core\Conditions\Config.lua:758>
(tail call): ?
[C]: ?
[string "safecall Dispatcher[4]"]:9: in function <[string "safecall Dispatcher[4]"]:5>
(tail call): ?
Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:799: in function `Fire'
...Ons\TellMeWhen\Components\Core\Conditions\Config.lua:649: in function `LoadAndDraw'
...Ons\TellMeWhen\Components\Core\Conditions\Config.lua:113: in function `LoadConfig'
[string "*:OnLoad"]:3: in function `OnClick'
...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua:2193: in function `TabClick'
[string "*:OnClick"]:1: in function <[string "*:OnClick"]:1>

Locals: <none>

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)

After getting the error the whole condition editor bugs out, putting wrong variables to conditions and hiding/showing wrong ui elements.


> Posted by CurseForge user Beruchan | Imported from CurseForge issue #709 | Raw

comments.body:
This issue has already been fixed: http://wow.curseforge.com/addons/tellmewhen/files/


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
